channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Name more streets after women, urges S'pore Council of Women's Organisations
item.description:
September 19, 2021 7:45 PM

Only about 40 streets here are named after women, compared with some 540 roads named after men.

item.title: Disciplinary inquiry into Parti Liyani's complaint against DPPs heard over four days
item.description:
September 19, 2021 7:26 PM

The closed-door hearing was held from Sept 6 to 9, with the former domestic worker testifying via video link from Indonesia.

item.title: 2,322 travellers from Germany, Brunei approved to enter S'pore on Vaccinated Travel Lane scheme
item.description:
September 19, 2021 7:01 PM

SINGAPORE - More than 2,300 travellers vaccinated against Covid-19 have received approval to enter Singapore in the sixteen days since the application window for a new travel arrangement opened.

item.title: SIA and Changi Airport come out tops in new travel awards launched by Newsweek
item.description:
September 19, 2021 5:22 PM

SIA was named the winner in the international airline category, while Changi Airport took the international airport prize.

item.title: Covid-19 delays work to rebuild collapsed viaduct in Changi
item.description:
September 19, 2021 5:04 PM

The project is set to be completed in the second half of next year, instead of the first half.

item.title: Ayer Rajah Food Centre closed until Wednesday after Covid-19 cases detected
item.description:
September 19, 2021 4:38 PM

Deep cleaning and disinfection works will be carried out at the food centre at Block 503 West Coast Drive.

item.title: McDonald's to continue running Ridout Tea Garden outlet in Queensway after winning tender
item.description:
September 19, 2021 4:28 PM

It previously said it would cease operations there in December upon the expiry of its tenancy agreement.

item.title: Cambridge law grad, former IMH peer support specialist in new batch of Duke-NUS medical students
item.description:
September 19, 2021 4:26 PM

The two were among 72 individuals who joined Duke-NUS Medical School at a virtual White Coat Ceremony on Saturday.

item.title: SAF's 20 home vaccination teams of NSmen handled nearly 480 appointments in 3 days
item.description:
September 19, 2021 4:03 PM

They comprise 3rd Combat Support Hospital medical officers and combat medics on in-camp training.

item.title: Singapore Pools Toa Payoh outlet shuts after employee tests positive for Covid-19
item.description:
September 19, 2021 3:19 PM

 The Block 111 Lorong 1 Toa Payoh outlet is closed until further notice.

item.title: Best foods to boost your kids' brain power this exam season
item.description:
September 19, 2021 3:00 PM

They can help to boost your kids' concentration and memory.

item.title: Be a coach and cheerleader for your child during exam season
item.description:
September 19, 2021 3:00 PM

 A week before the PSLE, listening to your children and showing them your unwavering support is key.

item.title: Fun with kids: Science Centre's learning festival, pancake treat, picture book
item.description:
September 19, 2021 3:00 PM

Make family time all the more special with these ideas and activities.

item.title: Minor Issues: How my sons went from mac and cheese to mee pok
item.description:
September 19, 2021 3:00 PM

They spent their early years in the US and grew fond of simple flavours enhanced by salt and fat.

item.title: Younger, fully vaccinated Covid-19 patients should recover at home amid strained hospitals: Ong Ye Kung
item.description:
September 19, 2021 12:57 PM

A&E departments and general wards are "coming under pressure" while overall ICU capacity is holding up, Ong Ye Kung said.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on Sept 19
item.description:
September 19, 2021 8:35 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Sunday, Sept 19.

item.title: Why knowing sexual history and what victim wore could help police in rape investigations
item.description:
September 19, 2021 5:00 AM

Between 2018 and last year, the number of reported rapes in Singapore has steadily increased.

item.title: Helping rape victims in Singapore who come forward
item.description:
September 19, 2021 5:00 AM

Between 2018 and 2020, the number of reported rapes each year has steadily increased in Singapore.

item.title: Singaporeans still out and about but more cautious as daily Covid-19 cases rise
item.description:
September 19, 2021 5:00 AM

Many are taking more precautions like avoiding crowded areas.

item.title: Masks from Temasek Foundation: More than 2.6m boxes collected
item.description:
September 19, 2021 5:00 AM

SINGAPORE - When Ms Chong Lee Lee, 56, went to Northpoint Cold Storage days after Temasek Foundation began its mask distribution exercise, there was no stock.

item.title: ‘My toughest assignment': Khaw Boon Wan on his new role as SPH Media Trust chairman
item.description:
September 19, 2021 5:00 AM

Mr Khaw Boon Wan came out of retirement to chair SPH Media Trust. He tells Executive Editor Sumiko Tan what his priorities are.

item.title: Doctor out cycling with friends helps deliver baby at bus stop in Upper Thomson Road
item.description:
September 19, 2021 5:00 AM

He directed aid and reassured the parents during chance encounter on a cycling trip with friends.

item.title: SPH Media Trust chairman Khaw Boon Wan sets his sights on accelerating digital transformation in newsrooms
item.description:
September 19, 2021 5:00 AM

Resources in ST newsroom to be expanded, TNP to go fully digital and BT newsroom to lead in transformation.

item.title: F&B outlets in CBD hardest hit as people avoid social gatherings
item.description:
September 19, 2021 5:00 AM

But those outside CBD said drop was bigger on weekends with more families staying home.

item.title: Organisations serving the elderly cut down on physical interactions as Covid-19 cases rise
item.description:
September 19, 2021 5:00 AM

They have taken a cautious approach by reducing the number of physical interactions seniors are exposed to.

item.title: Asean power grid — option for S'pore to source green energy
item.description:
September 19, 2021 4:00 AM

Trial to import electricity from Malaysia the first step to larger imports of clean energy from South-east Asian neighbours

item.title: S'pore's new Covid-19 cases cross 1,000 mark; unvaccinated man, 90, dies from complications
item.description:
September 19, 2021 12:14 AM

There are 1,009 new cases, including 926 in the community.
